clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes of Single Stage Versus Two-stage Treatment of Severe Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcomes of Single Stage Versus Two-stage Laparoscopic Roux-en-y Gastric Bypass in the Management of Super Obesity: a Propensity Score Weighted Analysis'

brief_summary.textblock: Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (LRYGB) in super obese patients (BMI≥50kg/m2) is a challenging operation. Weight reduction with intragastric balloon (IGB) prior to LRYGB may improve operative outcomes and improves weight loss. We assessed 155 patients, with a BMI≥50 kg/m2 who underwent either intra-gastric balloon (IGB) insertion followed by LRYGB (two-stage group), or LRYGB as the definitive bariatric procedure (single-stage group) in our institution. Two stage procedure was adopted for high-risk individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of total weight loss measured in kilograms following Bariatric Surgery
primary_outcome.description: Percentage total weight loss is the proportion of weight lost in kilograms since the intervention of the weight before the intervention. This will be calculated by using the following formula. Initial weight is considered the weight on the day of surgery and Postop weight considered as the weight 24 months following Bariatric Surgery (intervention). Percent of total weight loss (%TWL)=((Initial Weight)-(Postop Weight)): Initial Weight x 100 Weight is expressed in kilograms.

primary_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay in days following Bariatric Surgery
primary_outcome.description: Hospital stay following laparoscopic gastric bypass surgery measured in days and compared between the groups.

intervention.description: Insertion of Gastric balloon prior to laparoscopic gastric bypass surgery

study_pop.textblock: patients, with a BMI≥50 kg/m2 undergoing Bariatric Surgery in Chelsea and Westminster Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients, with a BMI≥50 kg/m2, underwent either intra-gastric balloon (IGB) insertion followed by LRYGB (two-stage group), or LRYGB as the definitive bariatric procedure (single-stage group)
Exclusion Criteria:
- NA
